title: An Overview on Cricket Whites (Aaron Joness)
text: By Aaron Joness Oct 21, 2015 The game of cricket consists of a vast set of rules and laws. To cite some, it is played in an oval shaped pitch,between two teams of eleven players each. One team bats while attempting to score runs and the other delivers and fields the ball, besides making an effort to limit the scoring and terminate the batsmen one by one.The game-play also requires both teams to be uniformly dressed in whites,consisting of flannel trousers, a polo shirt, a pullover, spiked shoes and a jockstrap with a box guard.In the past, cricket clothing was generally made up of flannel and linen like fabrics, whereas the modern uniforms have trousers made with an extra elastic and Lycra content to increase the comfort level while playing. Formerly, as pointed out by its name cricket whites, it was entirely made of white or cream. But currently, the one-day versions and short matches are played in coloured kits that are comically identified as pyjamas.While the shirts, jumpers and pullovers can be short or long-sleeved, the choice of clothing ultimately depends on what the players find comfortable. The pullovers are customarily made with a cable-knit design in wool base.The clothing is specially made for the games' purpose by many brands like Nike, Puma, and Adidas and so on. They can be brought in whites' as well coloured kit. The only hitch is that one must buy all these articles together so as to use them as a set. Enthusiasts and young aspirants can purchase clothing sets at leading outlets in any size or colour. Many sports brands also stock the official jerseys and merchandise of international teams.At the international level, cricket whites are worn on occasion of Test cricket tournaments. Whereas One Day International and Twenty20 matches are played with all participants wearing team uniforms in colour. It is customised, designed and manufactured by top sports brands. All such brands have multiple portals selling their goods on a large scale basis in each and every part of the globe.The uniform kit also includes spiked shoes that increase traction, safety glasses for the wicket-keeper, and helmets for the batsman. All of these are easily accessible at retail outlets or online shopping websites. Helmets are of paramount importance for the batsman as it guards the skull and shields the head as well as facial area from a deflected ball. It consists of a cap like shell, but harder along with a grill and visor. Additionally, thigh guards, arm guards, chest guards, and elbow guards are also a must to protect the body of the batsmen.The two batsmen and the wicket-keeper must wear leg pads too for the protection of the shin bone against impact from the ball.Gloves are only for batsmen, they are thickly padded above the fingers, the thumb and the back of the hand, to protect them from the hard cricket ball.Apart from indispensable cricket essentials like cricket clothing, players are also required to have a cricket equipment kit, which consist of more tools like, bat, ball, stumps, and bails, and so on. A professional, an aspirant or young cricketer, all must have these kits to master the game of cricket. About the Author Aaron Jones is an all-rounder athlete in training, who takes part in different types of sports. He also likes to blog about his different interests during his spare time. Through this article provides an overview of the cricket clothing kit as well as the different cricket equipment that are crucial for this sport. Rating:
